name: Create Webhook
description: Create a new webhook. Requires the MANAGE_WEBHOOKS permission. Returns a webhook object on success. Webhook names follow our naming restrictions that can be found in our Usernames and Nicknames documentation, with the following additional stipulations:

params.name: name
params.description: name of the webhook

params.name: avatar
params.description: image for the default webhook avatar

name: Get Channel Webhooks
description: Returns a list of channel webhook objects. Requires the MANAGE_WEBHOOKS permission.

name: Get Guild Webhooks
description: Returns a list of guild webhook objects. Requires the MANAGE_WEBHOOKS permission.

name: Get Webhook
description: Returns the new webhook object for the given id.

name: Get Webhook with Token

value: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication and returns no user in the webhook object.

description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication and returns no user in the webhook object.

name: Modify Webhook
description: Modify a webhook. Requires the MANAGE_WEBHOOKS permission. Returns the updated webhook object on success.

params.name: name
params.description: the default name of the webhook

params.name: avatar
params.description: image for the default webhook avatar

params.name: channel_id
params.description: the new channel id this webhook should be moved to

name: Modify Webhook with Token

value: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication, does not accept a channel_id parameter in the body, and does not return a user in the webhook object.

description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication, does not accept a channel_id parameter in the body, and does not return a user in the webhook object.

name: Delete Webhook

value: Delete a webhook permanently. Requires the MANAGE_WEBHOOKS permission. Returns a 204 No Content response on success.

description: Delete a webhook permanently. Requires the MANAGE_WEBHOOKS permission. Returns a 204 No Content response on success.

name: Delete Webhook with Token
description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication.

name: Execute Webhook

query.name: wait
query.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response, and returns the created message body

query.name: thread_id
query.description: Send a message to the specified thread within a webhook's channel. The thread will automatically be unarchived.

description: Refer to Uploading Files for details on attachments and multipart/form-data requests.

params.name: content
params.description: the message contents

params.name: username
params.description: override the default username of the webhook

params.name: avatar_url
params.description: override the default avatar of the webhook

params.name: tts
params.description: true if this is a TTS message

params.name: embeds
params.description: embedded `rich` content

params.name: allowed_mentions
params.description: allowed mentions for the message

params.name: components
params.description: the components to include with the message

params.name: files
params.description: the contents of the file being sent

params.name: payload_json
params.description: JSON encoded body of non-file params

params.name: attachments
params.description: attachment objects with filename and description

params.name: flags
params.description: combined as a

name: Execute Slack-Compatible Webhook

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread to send the message in

query.name: wait
query.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response

description: Refer to Slack's documentation for more information. We do not support Slack's channel , icon_emoji , mrkdwn , or mrkdwn_in properties.

name: Execute GitHub-Compatible Webhook

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread to send the message in

query.name: wait
query.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response

description: Add a new webhook to your GitHub repo , and use this endpoint as the "Payload URL." You can choose what events your Discord channel receives by choosing the "Let me select individual events" option and selecting individual events for the new webhook you're configuring.

name: Get Webhook Message

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread the message is in

description: Returns a previously-sent webhook message from the same token. Returns a message object on success.

name: Edit Webhook Message

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread the message is in

description: Edits a previously-sent webhook message from the same token. Returns a message object on success.

params.name: content
params.description: the message contents

params.name: embeds
params.description: embedded `rich` content

params.name: allowed_mentions
params.description: allowed mentions for the message

params.name: components
params.description: the components to include with the message

params.name: files
params.description: the contents of the file being sent/edited

params.name: payload_json
params.description: JSON encoded body of non-file params

params.name: attachments
params.description: attached files to keep and possible descriptions for new files

name: Delete Webhook Message

query.name: thread_id
query.description: id of the thread the message is in

value: Deletes a message that was created by the webhook. Returns a 204 No Content response on success.

description: Deletes a message that was created by the webhook. Returns a 204 No Content response on success.
